item.title: 10 Noise Transformations
item.description: An exploration into interesting transformations of noise*.

item.title: Kanban And Wellbeing
item.description: I couldn’t agree more with Amy’s post Can We Kanban? on the OVO Tech Blog, where she detailed their decision to switch from Scrum to Kanban.

item.title: Rotralva
item.description: Lines like rungs of a ladder eminate from the core, spiraling and dissolving as they are left behind

item.title: Stratata
item.description: Inspired by layered patterns exposed in cliffs

item.title: Dizoolexa
item.description: 20,000 particle trails through a simplex curl field

item.title: Loopnova
item.description: Some initial experiments with simulating slime mold Physarum polycephalum - from very simple mechanisms the mold is able to efficiently scavenge for and transport food through emergent networks of paths.

item.title: Aloidia
item.description: Points on the edge of two circles are connected by a faint light. As the points move around their circle, the emitted light slowly begins to build up and change color.

item.title: Inkdrop I - Mizule
item.description: Several ink droppers roam the canvas at different heights, dropping ink at regular intervals.

item.title: Radfold
item.description: Started as a hobby project to recreate Orbit Clock (Jared Tarbell) in Golang, but some interesting glitches appeared (likely coding errors on my part somewhere…), leading to a more scaffold-like structure in places.

item.title: Wisps III: Brokencircle
item.description: The third in the Wisps series, using the same technique as Wisps I and Wisps II.

item.title: Wisps II: Darknaught
item.description: The second in the Wisps series, using the same technique as Wisps I.

item.title: Wisps I: Dualline
item.description: The first in a series. These are generated using a technique based on Orbitals by Anders Hoff, which in turn was inspired by Happy Place by Jared Tarbell.

item.title: Hi, I am Shaun.
item.description: I am a Production Engineer, DevOps enthusiast and generative art hobbyist. I have worn a variety of different hats over the years. In reverse chronological order: Production Engineer Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) Developer Forensic Data Analyst E-Discovery Review Manager Mathematics and Statistics masters graduate My professional interests include: DevOps principals Continuous improvement CI/CD Cloud application security Infrastructure as code My personal interests include:
